mcqs.question: How can you add a CSS comment in your stylesheet?
mcqs.explanation: CSS comments use `/* comment */` syntax for both single and multi-line comments.

mcqs.question: What is the main purpose of comments in CSS?
mcqs.explanation: Comments are used for documentation and explanations within the CSS code for developers.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is a valid CSS comment?
mcqs.explanation: Only `/* comment */` is valid CSS comment syntax.

mcqs.question: Where can you place comments in a CSS file?
mcqs.explanation: CSS comments can be placed anywhere in the CSS file.

mcqs.question: What effect do comments have on the rendering of a web page?
options: They are ignored by the browser
They are shown to the user
mcqs.explanation: Comments are ignored by browsers and have no effect on rendering.

mcqs.question: Which of these will cause an error in your CSS file?
mcqs.explanation: `//` is not a valid CSS comment. Nested comments are also not allowed in CSS.

mcqs.question: How does a CSS minifier treat comments by default?
mcqs.explanation: Minifiers usually remove all comments to reduce file size.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid use for CSS comments?
mcqs.explanation: Comments are for documentation, not for styling elements.

mcqs.question: Can you use comments to prevent part of a CSS rule from running?
options: Yes, by wrapping the code in `/* ... */`
No, comments do not affect rules
Only at the top of the file
mcqs.explanation: You can 'comment out' lines by wrapping them in `/* ... */`.

mcqs.question: Which of these will cause all CSS below it to be ignored?
options: A syntax error in a comment
mcqs.explanation: A missing closing comment tag (`*/`) can cause the browser to ignore the rest of the CSS file.

mcqs.question: Are CSS comments visible to users in the browser?
options: No, but visible in developer tools
No, not even in source code
Only if the page is printed
mcqs.explanation: Comments are not rendered, but can be seen in the browser's developer tools or source view.

mcqs.question: What happens if you put a CSS comment inside a property value?
mcqs.explanation: If a comment interrupts a property value, the property may be ignored by the browser.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is a multi-line CSS comment?
Can you comment out an entire CSS rule?
options: No, only one line at a time
mcqs.explanation: You can comment out any section of CSS, including full rules, by wrapping them in `/* ... */`.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is TRUE about CSS comments?
options: They are required for every rule
They help document code for humans
They change how the browser renders styles
They are visible on the web page
mcqs.explanation: CSS comments are for documentation and do not affect rendering.
